National idea will eventually be undermined, repudiated and denounced,
if not actually murdered, by selfish leaders who seek power and money;
men whose hot heads are controlled even now only by cold feet.
There are evidences of the betterment of law and order every-
That is hopeful.
City walls pulled down to permit the new
highways to enter and leave,
good roads building everywhere,
telephone and radio communication, etc.
Just now we flew over a sugar
loaf shaped mountain on the
top of which a wall had been built to en-
close an area of possibly four acres.
In the center of the area &
small pond partly full of water.
the precipitous heights of the
sugar loaf zig zag trails from the villages in
the peaceful valleys
The zig zag trails seem long neglected as indicated by small
uncleared land slides and thick underbrush covering the
several narrow
trails in many places.
In the
the existence of law and order
was the exception rather than the rule,
the first hint of trouble sent
the natives, like our New England ancestors, scurrying up to the se-
clusion and comparative safety of this natural large scale "block house!
the impenetrable strength of which was assured by the precipitous cliffs
on all sides.
The era which sees these strongholds go to rack and
ruin while concurrently the
temples and historic shrines are being re-
paired and reconstructed is truly an important one and there is hope
yet for China.
think that Chiang Kai-shek with the backing of a world
a small but well equipped loyal army,
rule all China.
The Chinese aviators are mostly American trained and fly American
planes but they are still Chinese with the same ideas and objectives
as their fellow countrymen.
With a few exceptions, very few,
be expected to act like any other
Chinese military
or political leaders.
Arriving at Wenchow the fog had happily moved out and the sun
was shining brightly.
the small station house the deck
of the barge was still wet evidencing the accuracy of our previous
weather reports.
Now as I write we have left Wenchow, Foochow and Amoy and are
headed for Swatow.
I have just counted 22 separate and distinct forest
fires - obviously not accidental as they are too far apart to have
caught fire from a spark.
Just makes me sick to see it.
This country
here is about like the mountains round about Lake George - only not a
- just low scrub which will undoubtedly be burned before it can
up the mountainside.
Now below is another "block house" with
the wall fallen down on one side and no trails
visible at all.
foot of the hill runs the modern highway which leads from Amoy to
Swatow.

and find that this is my
twenty-seventh trip
on the 1000 miles route

kong â€¢

fine embroid-
embroidery and now,
think I wrote you once before,
the industry is one of China's most im-
portant ones.
Before starting this trip I wrote to a friend in Swatow
Just now when we taxied up- to the
bundle under his arm and a letter from my friend sending a shawl with
his compliments.
Haven't opened the box but hope it is a good one. Also
have a little Ming blanc de
chine eight sided cup for Debby and a drawing
book for Cat.
Don't know how I'll square myself with Hebe unless I have
Challe
to make a purchase on the way home.
Approaching Hongkong.
As ever,
